Package database

Class AppointmentQuery

java.lang.Object
database.AppointmentQuery
public class AppointmentQuery extends Object
A utility class for handling database queries and appointment data retrieval from the database. It uses prepared statements to ensure secure and efficient database access.

  • Method Details

    • getAppointmentList

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointmentList()
      Fetches all appointments from the "appointments" table, joined with the "contacts" table. Uses a prepared statement with a SELECT query to retrieve data. Loops through the result set and creates Appointment objects based on the retrieved data. Catches and prints any SQL exceptions.
      Returns:
      ObservableList of Appointment objects

    • modifyAppointment

      public static void modifyAppointment(int appointmentId, String title, String description, String location, String type, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int customerId, int userId, int contactId)
      Updates an existing appointment with the provided information. Uses a prepared statement with an UPDATE query. Sets the prepared statement parameters based on the provided arguments. Executes the statement and throws a RuntimeException if an SQL exception occurs.
      Parameters:
      appointmentId - The unique identifier for the appointment.
      title - The title of the appointment.
      description - The description of the appointment.
      location - The location of the appointment.
      type - The type of the appointment.
      start - The start date and time of the appointment.
      end - The end date and time of the appointment.
      customerId - The ID of the customer associated with the appointment.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with the appointment.
      contactId - The ID of the contact related to the appointment.

    • addAppointment

      public static void addAppointment(String title, String description, String location, String type, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int customerId, int userId, int contactId)
      Inserts a new appointment into the "appointments" table. Uses a prepared statement with an INSERT query. Sets the prepared statement parameters based on the provided arguments. Executes the statement and throws a RuntimeException if an SQL exception occurs.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the appointment.
      description - The description of the appointment.
      location - The location of the appointment.
      type - The type of the appointment.
      start - The start date and time of the appointment.
      end - The end date and time of the appointment.
      customerId - The ID of the customer associated with the appointment.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with the appointment.
      contactId - The ID of the contact related to the appointment.

    • getApptByWeek

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getApptByWeek()
      Fetches appointments scheduled within the current week (starting from now). Uses a prepared statement with a SELECT query that filters based on the start date. Creates Appointment objects from the result set and adds them to an ObservableList. Catches and prints any SQL exceptions. Returns the ObservableList of appointments for the current week.
      Returns:
      ObservableList of Appointment objects.

    • deleteAppointment

      public static void deleteAppointment(int appointmentId)
      Deletes an appointment from the "appointments" table based on the provided ID. Uses a prepared statement with a DELETE query. Sets the prepared statement parameter to the appointment ID. Executes the statement and throws a RuntimeException if an SQL exception occurs.
      Parameters:
      appointmentId - appointment's ID

    • getMonthlyAppointment

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getMonthlyAppointment()
      Retrieves appointments for the current month (starting from now). Uses a prepared statement with a SELECT query that filters based on the start date. Creates Appointment objects from the result set and adds them to an ObservableList. Catches and prints any SQL exceptions.
      Returns:
      The ObservableList of appointments for the current month.

    • getUserAppointment

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getUserAppointment(int userID)
      Fetches appointments specific to a user based on their ID. Uses a prepared statement with a SELECT query that filters by user ID. Creates Appointment objects from the result set and adds them to an ObservableList. Catches and prints any SQL exceptions.
      Parameters:
      userID - user's ID
      Returns:
      The ObservableList of appointments for the specified user.

    • getAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointments(int customerId)
      Retrieves appointments for a specific customer based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      customerId - customer's ID
      Returns:
      customerAppointment

    • getContactAppointment

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getContactAppointment(int contactID)
      Similar to getUserAppointment, but retrieves appointments associated with a specific contact based on their ID. Fetches appointments specific to a contact based on their contact ID. Uses a prepared statement with a SELECT query that filters by contact ID. Creates Appointment objects from the result set and adds them to an ObservableList. Catches and prints any SQL exceptions.
      Parameters:
      contactID - contact's id
      Returns:
      The ObservableList of appointments for the specified contact

    • getAppointmentType

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointmentType()
      Counts the number of appointments for each type
      Returns:
      The results as a list of Appointment objects with "type" and "count" fields.

    • getAppointmentTypeMonth

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointmentTypeMonth()
      Counts the number of appointments for each month
      Returns:
      The results as a list of Appointment objects with "month" and "count" fields.
